intro: Collospermum samoense, commonly known as the Samoan morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with heart-shaped leaves and produces showy blooms that open in the morning. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal areas and moist woodlands. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
